subject: Re: [junit] Problems with classpath, junit.jar, and win98
msgSnippet: Doesn t win98 still use ini files? If it does, you could add the necessary JUNIT_HOME to the ini file and update the path to include %JUNIT_HOME% bin. At least
messageBody:
Doesn't win98 still use ini files? If it does, you could add the
necessary JUNIT_HOME to the ini file and update the path to include
%JUNIT_HOME%\bin.

At least I think that's what I remember doing with an old WinME box
that I have. I gave it to my daughter for her Winnie-the-Pooh games,
so I doubt I could get it back to try it out.

Hope that helps.


On Sat, 26 Mar 2005 23:40:15 -0000, seanmarillion23
<seanmarillion@...> wrote:
>
>
> I have tried to put the junit.jar in the classpath using sysedit on
> the autoexec.bat and it says it cannot find it. I have tried to
> rename the directory, unzip the junit.jar even. It does work if I
> unzip the jar file and run the program the long way: java
> jhome.junit.swingui.TestRunner then the tested file. It runs that way
> but I want it to be available in my other directories. I guess I
> should say global. Any suggestions? As I said in the subject I am
> still using win98. I am cheap. Thanks for your time.
>
